alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 7:17PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Crockett County through 800 PM CDT... At 715 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over southern Crockett County, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ozona, The Intersection Of Us 190 And Highway 163, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2083 And Highway 405, The Intersection Of Highway 163 And Ranch Road 1973, I-10 Near The Crockett-Pecos County Line, Ft Lancaster, The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405 and The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 290. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 327 and 379. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
